de.esoco.lib.expression.predicate

Class ExceptionMappingBinaryPredicate<L,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.expression.function.AbstractFunction<L,O>
        • de.esoco.lib.expression.function.AbstractBinaryFunction<L,R,java.lang.Boolean>
          • de.esoco.lib.expression.predicate.AbstractBinaryPredicate<L,R>
            • de.esoco.lib.expression.predicate.ExceptionMappingBinaryPredicate<L,R>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BinaryFunction<L,R,java.lang.Boolean>, BinaryPredicate<L,R>, java.util.function.Function<L,java.lang.Boolean>, java.util.function.Predicate<L>, Relatable

    public abstract class ExceptionMappingBinaryPredicate<L,R>
extends AbstractBinaryPredicate<L,R>
    A binary predicate base class that allows subclasses to throw arbitrary exceptions from their evaluation. Any such exception will be mapped to a runtime exception and then re-thrown from the AbstractBinaryFunction.evaluate(Object) method. This method is overridden to be final, subclasses must implement the abstract method evaluateWithException(Object, Object) instead. All exception mapping function implementations in the framework convert exceptions into FunctionException so that mapped exceptions can be detected.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public final java.lang.Boolean evaluate(L rLeftValue,
                                        R rRightValue)
        Overridden to invoke evaluateWithException(Object, Object) and to convert any occurring exception into a runtime exception.
        Parameters:
        rLeftValue - The left value to evaluate
        rRightValue - The right value to evaluate
        Returns:
        The result of the evaluation
        See Also:
        Function.evaluate(Object)

      • evaluateWithException

        protected abstract java.lang.Boolean evaluateWithException(L rLeftValue,
                                                           R rRightValue)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This method must be implemented by subclasses to perform the function evaluation. The method may throw any type of exception to signal an error. The invoking evaluate(Object, Object) method will convert such exceptions into runtime exceptions.
        Parameters:
        rLeftValue - The left input value for the evaluation
        rRightValue - The right input value for the evaluation
        Returns:
        The result of the evaluation
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs
